titleStmt.title: Joseph Hennin and Charles Dupree, Bond
CWG4545

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
We Joseph Hennin principle
Chas Dupree Security
do bind ourselves three months after date to pay The commonwealth of Ky (The plaintiff in Execution) The sum of Five Hundred and twenty four dollars and 84 cents. with Interest thereon from this date being the amount of prinicpal, interest and cost of an Execution No 322 which issued from the clerks office of the Nelson Circuit Court on the 9th day of March 1862 in favor of the said commonwealth for the sum of
Principal $500 cts
interest 5.50
Cost 9 30
Sheriff half com 9.64
writing Bond 40 commission and forty ceents for writing amounting in the whole to the (this Bond Sum of
amount $524.84 cts
against the Said Jos Hennin -- and we the said Jos Hennin Principal and Chas Dupree- Security have replievid the same witnesseth our hands and Seals this 31_ day of May - 1862.

attest S S Meddis
D Sssr,
J. Wash Davis [Seal]
S.J C
The above bonds was given in satisfaction of an Exam & Henin as bailee of Paul Garras under charge Larceny in Nelson Circuit Court
